channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping next to cycle hanger, 17th September
item.description:
A few days ago a pile of trash appeared on the street next to the cycle hanger (cyclehanger_2160) I use. It was obstructing the door of the hanger and also some car parking space.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin full of rubbish left outside number 98 harcourt avenue, 17th September
item.description:
There is a random bin thats been left between number 96 and 98 harcourt avenue, this doesn't belong to any residents in that end of road, this was empty and now as its been left is full up with peoples rubbish. With the strong winds this has blow over and all the contents have blown on peoples drives and down the street, this also needs to be cleared and can the bin be removed please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Harcourt Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not Fixed - 28 days have past. Traffic released from Southwood Rd under Green traffic light before traffic turning right into Green Lane from Sidcup Rd A20 has cleared the junction. Very Dangerous., 17th September
item.description:
Not Fixed - 28 days have past. Traffic released from Southwood Rd under Green traffic light before traffic turning right into Green Lane from Sidcup Rd A20 has cleared the junction. Very Dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footway Obstruction, 17th September
item.description:
Scaffolding has been placed fully obstructing the footway. No diversion route or parking suspension is provided forcing parents with buggies and/or young children and wheelchair users to have to use the carriageway to pass. No scaffolding license is on display.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ringers Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Only stump of cycle lane batton remains, 17th September
item.description:
Bus knocked down cycle batton, cycle lane used for bus and parking. Only base of batton remains. Maybe consider a harder cycle lane barrier plus hard decision in middle of road to stop vehicles turning right going onto wrong side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 235-239, High Road, Hornsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
